article_text:
Buy Photo Morton Avenue in the Original Highlands becomes heavily congested with very little parking between the hours of 9 p.m. to 4 a.m. on the weekends. 3/26/16 (Photo: Marty Pearl/Special to The C-J)Buy Photo

Several changes over the past decade have led to an even tighter parking crunch along the Louisville's Bardstown Road and Baxter Avenue corridor.

Yet residents who deal with visitors parking along their neighborhood streets and city leaders who advocate for multi-modal transportation do not seem to agree on a solution to the problem.

Below, vote for what you think is the best answer. And if your idea varies, let reporter Bailey Loosemore know by emailing bloosemore@courier-journal.com.

Viewing this on your phone? Click here to vote.

Read or Share this story: http://cjky.it/1N1Fj2o
